page.title: 20RAILWAY LINES
page.content: The Plymouth to Penzance railway line runs right past our school. In fact our teachers often have to stop talking when a train goes past. Keyham Station is just 200 metres from the school. Trains to and from Cornwall and the Tamar Valley stop there to allow Dockyard workers to travel to and from work. The old Southern Railway used to run through the area but that is now disused. The present track is the old Great Western track. There are many old bridges, two big viaducts and two tunnels in the area. One bridge has loose planks which vibrate when a train goes over; it is known locally as 'Shaky Bridge'. A disused tunnel which is blocked off partway in is known as 'Darkies' Some children play in there. One railway line goes into the dockyard. People say it is used for nuclear waste.
